title: League Displays ERROR
body:
i get the following ERROR when opening the new League Displays

"League Displays i s currently unable to access d:\Users\XXX\AppData\Local,  which is required in order to download art and set your wallpaper and screensavers. Please modify your computer permissions settings to allow League Displays access to that folder."

Any tips on how i would give league displays these permissions? 

NOTE: I chose all the default options when installing and didn't have any issues with the previous wallpaper app 

Thanks in advance

replies.body:
You should just be able to right click and choose "run as administrator" (or right click-> properties-> compatibility-> check "run as administrator"). 

There's a chance you may also need to reinstall with admin rights specifically.

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=dsafYWZT,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-12-07T03:32:25.752+0000)
>
> You should just be able to right click and choose "run as administrator" (or right click-> properties-> compatibility-> check "run as administrator"). 
> 
> There's a chance you may also need to reinstall with admin rights specifically.

Hello,

I tried running league displays as admin but got the same error. I also uninstalled it and then ran the install exe again as admin but same issue

Hmmmm alrighty. Go ahead and hit up our techs in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and make sure you send over some game logs as well, they can use those to dive a bit deeper and figure out what's going wrong! 

You can generate those logs by using the [**Hextech Repair Tool**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool) if needed!

Any idea how to resolve this issue yet? I have installed as administrator and the program is being launched as an administrator yet still getting this error. Is it due to the fact that my User folder is not on the same drive as my OS?
Same problem here. Tried setting permissions in every possible way that can help it but with no success
